bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.V. McClain, January 22, 1941

div1.p: Hench expresses gratitude for the receipt of the Alumni Bulletin, from Washington and Jefferson College, but requests additional copies. He wants to use the publication in connection with his campaign to memorialize Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.V. McClain, January 22, 1941
div1.opener:
January 22, 1941
Mr. A. V. McClain
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
My dear Mr. McClain:
div1.p:
Thank you kindly for sending me the Alumni Bulletins. I
appreciated them immensely.

I have just written to Dr. Hutchison, requesting what I am
afraid is a rather large number of both the brochures and the bulletins. I
can assure you this is not for personal exploitation but for use in connection
with my campaign to memorialize Camp Lazear properly. By the way, how did
your motion picture film ever turn out?

I have been so busy that my good intentions to write you about
the extra special, superfine brochure have gone for naught! But my letter
and wire to Hutch doubtlessly were transmitted to you. When I first opened
and read the announcement about Hench, I laughed, but as the afternoon wore
on, I got colder and colder feet and by night I was considerably in a tizzy.
You will never know the earnest effort put into my wire, and I can just see
you laughing at me heartily. You certainly put one over on me. I can
assure you that later I quite enjoyed the joke and have shown the brochure
and Hutch's wire to my friends, who enjoyed with me the very good joke which
you all played on me. I warn you--an elephant and a Hench never forgets.
Next time it will be my turn to pull one on you boys!
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
